text: Elizabeth Brackett (December 11, 1941 â€“ June 17, 2018) was an American journalist and political figure and writer. She was known for hosting WTTW- TV's Chicago Tonight program and also worked as a correspondent for PBS' The NewsHour with Jim Lehrer. In 1988, Brackett was awarded a Peabody Award for her coverage of the 1988 U.S. presidential election. Brackett was born in Illinois. She studied at Indiana University. Brackett was injured in a serious accident while biking on the Lakefront Trail on June 13, 2018.Elizabeth Brackett, Award-Winning Journalist and Triathlete, Dies at 76 She suffered from a fractured vertebrae, fell into a coma and died four days after the accident at a Chicago hospital, aged 76. ==References== Category:Peabody Award winners Category:1941 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Accidental deaths in Chicago Category:American television presenters Category:American political writers Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Triathletes
title: Elizabeth Brackett
